snippet: The Saudi Defense Ministry said the objectives in its bombing of Yemen’s Iran-backed Houthi rebels, which threatened to ignite a broader regional conflict, had been achieved.
abstract: Saudi Arabia announces end of its almost one-month bombing campaign against Yemen's Iran-backed Houthi rebels, military operation that caused humanitarian crisis in Yemen and threatened to start bigger regional conflict; Pres Obama had pressured Saudis and other Sunni Arab nations to halt airstrikes.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and MARK MAZZETTI
byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim reported from Obock, and Mark Mazzetti from Washington. Reporting was contributed by Eric Schmitt and Michael D. Shear from Washington, Rick Gladstone from New York and Mohammed Ali Kalfood from Sana, Yemen.

lead_paragraph: The Saudi Defense Ministry said the objectives in its bombing of Yemen’s Iran-backed Houthi rebels, which threatened to ignite a broader regional conflict, had been achieved.

headline.main: Saudis Announce Halt to Yemen Bombing Campaign
headline.print_headline: Saudis Announce Halt to Bombing of Yemen Rebels
